audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization - automating routine patient inquiries to reduce operational workload. Replicable pattern for healthcare organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (UHCW NHS Trust) but lacks specific quantified metrics. Claims are directional ('aims to reduce') rather than achieved results.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Addresses patient care optimization through digital preparation. Replicable in pediatric healthcare settings.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Provides specific statistics (50-75% affected) but doesn't clearly establish how digital solution addresses this - more context than direct claim.
audited_claims.notes: Establishes problem scope but doesn't directly claim digital solution effectiveness

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Similar to C6 - addresses patient care optimization but connection to digital solution unclear.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific statistics (50% develop changes, 8% ongoing at one year) but doesn't establish digital solution impact.
audited_claims.notes: Provides problem quantification but lacks direct claim about digital solution effectiveness

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Cost optimization through reduced cancellations and better treatment adherence. Replicable benefit pattern.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization context but no specific metrics on cost savings achieved through digital preparation.
audited_claims.notes: Identifies cost optimization opportunity but lacks quantified results

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear cost and time efficiency improvement over traditional face-to-face preparation methods. Replicable across healthcare settings.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, clear comparison between current state (paper leaflets, single meeting) and digital alternative with cost/time constraints identified.
audited_claims.notes: Strong strategic fit with clear efficiency comparison, though specific savings not quantified

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Patient experience optimization through digital solution. 'Easily adoptable' suggests replicable implementation pattern.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, specific solution (Little Journey App), clear target population and outcome (enhanced patient experience).
audited_claims.notes: Clear functional enhancement with specific solution and target population identified

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. All claims focus on optimizing existing healthcare operations (patient communication, appointment management, pre-operative preparation) rather than creating new business models or revenue streams.
